  "article_text": [
    "the notion of _ goussarov - vassiliev finite type link invariants _ @xcite enables us to understand the various quantum invariants from a unifying viewpoint , see e.g. @xcite .",
    "the theory involves a descending filtration @xmath6 of the free abelian group @xmath7 generated by the set @xmath8 of the ambient isotopy classes of @xmath9-component , oriented , ordered links in @xmath10 . here",
    "each @xmath11 is generated by alternating sums of links over @xmath12 independent crossing changes .",
    "a homomorphism from @xmath7 to an abelian group @xmath13 is said to be a goussarov - vassiliev invariant of degree @xmath12 if it vanishes on @xmath14 .",
    "thus , for @xmath15 , we have @xmath16 if and only if @xmath0 and @xmath17 have the same values of goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath18 with values in any abelian group .",
    "it is natural to ask what kind of informations a goussarov - vassiliev link invariants can contain and what is the topological meaning of the unitrivalent diagrams . _",
    "calculus of claspers _ , introduced by goussarov and the first author @xcite , answers these questions .",
    "( we will recall the definition of claspers in section [ sec : claspers ] . ) a special type of claspers , called _ graph claspers _ , can be regarded as topological realizations of unitrivalent diagrams . for _ knots _ , claspers enables us to give a complete topological characterization of the informations that can be contained by goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath19 @xcite : the difference of two knots is in @xmath20 if and only if these two knots are _",
    "@xmath21-equivalent_. here @xmath21-equivalence is generated by a certain type of local moves , called _",
    "@xmath21-moves _ ( called _ @xmath22-variations _ by goussarov ) , which is defined as surgeries along certain tree claspers .    for links with more than @xmath23 components",
    ", the above - mentioned properties of goussarov - vassiliev invariants does not hold .",
    "it is true that if @xmath15 are @xmath21-equivalent , then we have @xmath24 , but the converse does not hold in general .",
    "a counterexample is milnor s link @xmath25 of @xmath5 components depicted in figure [ f34 ] : if @xmath26 , @xmath27 is ( @xmath21-equivalent but ) not @xmath28-equivalent to the @xmath2-component unlink @xmath29 , while we have @xmath30 ( but @xmath31 ) , see ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 7.4 ) .",
    "( this fact is contrasting to the case of _ string links _ :",
    "conjecturally ( * ? ? ?",
    "* conjecture 6.13 ) , two string links @xmath32 of the same number of components are @xmath21-equivalent if and only if @xmath33 . )",
    "milnor s links are typical examples of _ brunnian links_. recall that a link in an oriented , connected @xmath1-manifold is said to be brunnian if every proper sublink of it is an unlink . in some sense ,",
    "an @xmath12-component brunnian link is a ` pure @xmath12-component linking ' . thus studying",
    "the behavior of goussarov - vassiliev invariants on brunnian links would be a first step in understanding the goussarov - vassiliev invariants for links .",
    "the first author generalized a part of the above - mentioned properties of milnor s links to brunnian links :    [ r1 ] let @xmath0 be an @xmath2-component brunnian link in a connected , oriented @xmath1-manifold @xmath34 ( @xmath35 ) , and let @xmath29 be an @xmath2-component unlink in @xmath34 .",
    "then we have the following .    1",
    ".   @xmath0 and @xmath29 are @xmath21-equivalent .",
    "2 .   if @xmath26 , then we have @xmath36 .",
    "hence @xmath0 and @xmath29 are not distinguished by any goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath3 .",
    "the case @xmath37 of theorem [ r1 ] was announced in @xcite , and was later proved also by miyazawa and yasuhara @xcite , independently to @xcite .",
    "the purpose of the present paper is to study the restrictions of goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath4 to @xmath2-component brunnian links in @xmath10 , which is the first nontrivial case according to theorem [ r1 ] .",
    "the main result in the present paper expresses any such restriction as a _",
    "quadratic _ form of milnor @xmath38 link - homotopy invariants of length @xmath5 :    [ r6 ] let @xmath39 be any @xmath40-valued goussarov - vassiliev link invariant of degree @xmath4 .",
    "then there are ( non - unique ) integers @xmath41 for elements @xmath42 of the symmetric group @xmath43 on the set @xmath44 such that , for any @xmath2-component brunnian link @xmath0 , we have @xmath45 here , @xmath29 is an @xmath2-component unlink , and we set , for @xmath46 , @xmath47    a possible choice for the integers @xmath41 is given in terms of tree claspers in section [ sec : proof - theorem - refr6 ] .",
    "the proof of theorem [ r6 ] involves calculus of claspers .",
    "the first preprint version of the present paper ( arxiv : math.gt/0510534v1 ) contained a one - page sketch of an alternative proof of theorem [ r6 ] using the kontsevich integral .",
    "this alternative proof has been separated from the present paper , and has been published in @xcite .",
    "though shorter than the clasper - based proof below , the proof in @xcite relies heavily on the properties of unitrivalent diagrams , and the topological meaning of the steps in the proof are therefore not always very clear .",
    "the present proof gives a better understanding of theorem [ r6 ] from that point of view .",
    "recall that milnor invariants of length @xmath5 for string links are goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath18 @xcite ( see also @xcite ) .",
    "as is well - known , milnor s invariants is not well - defined for all links , and hence it does not make sense to ask whether milnor invariants of length @xmath5 is of degree @xmath18 or not .",
    "however , as theorem [ r6 ] indicates , a quadratic expression in such milnor invariants , which is well - defined at least for @xmath2-component brunnian links , may extend to a link invariant of degree @xmath48 .    in the study of milnor s invariants ,",
    "tree claspers seem at least as useful as cochran s construction @xcite . for the use of claspers in the study of the milnor invariants , see also @xcite .",
    "for other relationships between finite type invariants and the milnor invariants , see @xcite .",
    "we organize the rest of the paper as follows .    in section [ sec :",
    "claspers ] , we recall some definitions from clasper calculus .    in section [ sec",
    ": cak - equivalence ] , we recall the notion of @xmath49-equivalence for links , studied in @xcite . if a link @xmath0 is @xmath49-equivalent ( for any @xmath50 ) to a brunnian link , then @xmath0 also is a brunnian link .    in section [ sec : n+1-comp - brunn ] , we study the group @xmath51 of @xmath52-equivalence classes of @xmath2-component string links .",
    "we establish an isomorphism @xmath53 from an abelian group @xmath54 of certain tree diagrams .",
    "this map is essentially the inverse to the milnor link - homotopy invariants of length @xmath5 .    in section",
    "[ sec : group - bbnn ] , we apply the results in section [ sec : n+1-comp - brunn ] to brunnian links .",
    "the operation of closing string links induces a bijection @xmath55 where @xmath56 is the set of @xmath52-equivalence classes of @xmath2-component brunnian links . as a byproduct",
    ", we obtain another proof of a result of miyazawa and yasuhara @xcite .    in section [ sec : gouss - vass - filtr ]",
    ", we recall the definition of the goussarov - vassiliev filtration for links using claspers .    in section [ sec : gouss - vass - invar ]",
    ", we study the behavior of goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath4 for @xmath2-component brunnian links .",
    "we first show that two @xmath52-equivalent , @xmath2-component brunnian links can not be distinguished by goussarov - vassiliev invariants of degree @xmath4 .",
    "we have a quadratic map @xmath57 defined by @xmath58_{c^a_{n+1}})=[l - u]_{j_{2n+1}}$ ] .",
    "we prove theorem [ r6 ] , using @xmath59 .",
    "the authors wish to thank akira yasuhara for helpful conversations .",
    "in this section , we recall some definitions from calculus of claspers . for the details , we refer the reader to @xcite .    a _ clasper _ in an oriented @xmath1-manifold @xmath34 is a compact , possibly unorientable , embedded surface @xmath60 in @xmath61 equipped with a decomposition into connected subsurfaces called _ leaves _ , _ disk - leaves _ , _ nodes _ , _ boxes _ , and _ edges_. two distinct non - edge subsurfaces are disjoint .",
    "edges are disjoint bands which connect two subsurfaces of the other types . a connected component of the intersection of one edge @xmath62 and another subsurface @xmath63 ( of different type ) , which is an arc in @xmath64 , is called an _ attaching region _ of @xmath63 .    *",
    "a _ leaf _ is an annulus with one attaching region . *",
    "a _ disk - leaf _ is a disk with one attaching region . *",
    "a _ node _ is a disk with three attaching regions .",
    "( usually , a node is incident to three edges , but it is allowed that the two ends of one edge are attached to a node . ) * a _ box _ is a disk with three attaching regions .",
    "( the same remark as that for node applies here , too . ) moreover , one attaching region is distinguished with the other two .",
    "( this distinction is done by drawing a box as a rectangle , see @xcite . )    a clasper @xmath60 _ for _ a link @xmath0 in @xmath34 is a clasper in @xmath34 such that the intersection @xmath65 consists of finitely many transverse double points and is contained in the interior of the union of disk - leaves .",
    "we often use the drawing convention for claspers as described in @xcite .",
    "_ surgery along a clasper _",
    "@xmath60 is defined to be surgery along the _ associated framed link @xmath66 _ to @xmath60 . here",
    "@xmath66 is obtained from @xmath60 by the rules described in figure [ f27new ] .",
    "a _ tree clasper _ is a connected clasper @xmath67 without boxes , such that the union of edges and nodes of @xmath67 is simply connected .",
    "a tree clasper @xmath67 is called _ strict _ if each component of @xmath67 has no leaves and at least one disk - leaf .",
    "surgery along a strict tree clasper @xmath67 is _ tame _ in the sense of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 2.3 ) , i.e. , the result of surgery along @xmath67 preserves the @xmath1-manifold and the surgery may be regarded as a move on a link .",
    "a tree clasper @xmath67 for a link @xmath0 is _ simple _ ( with respect to @xmath0 ) if each disk - leaf of @xmath67 has exactly one intersection point with @xmath0 .",
    "the _ degree _ of a strict tree clasper @xmath60 is defined to be the number of nodes of @xmath67 plus @xmath23 . for @xmath35 ,",
    "@xmath21-tree _ is a strict tree clasper of degree @xmath12 .",
    "a _ ( simple ) @xmath21-move _ is a local move on links defined as surgery along a ( simple ) @xmath21-tree .",
    "for example , a simple @xmath68-move is a crossing change , and a simple @xmath69-move is a delta move @xcite .",
    "@xmath21-equivalence _ is the equivalence relation on links generated by @xmath21-moves .",
    "this equivalence relation is also generated by simple @xmath21-moves .",
    "the @xmath21-equivalence becomes finer as @xmath12 increases .",
    "we recall from @xcite the definition of the @xmath49-equivalence .",
    "[ r9 ] let @xmath0 be an @xmath9-component link in a @xmath1-manifold @xmath34 . for @xmath70 , a _",
    "@xmath49-tree _ for @xmath0 in @xmath34 is a @xmath71-tree @xmath67 for @xmath0 in @xmath34 , such that    1 .   for each disk - leaf @xmath13 of @xmath67 , all the strands intersecting @xmath13 are contained in one component of @xmath0 , and 2 .",
    "each component of @xmath0 intersects at least one disk - leaf of @xmath67 , i.e. , @xmath67 intersects all the components of @xmath0 .",
    "note that the condition ( 1 ) is vacuous if @xmath67 is simple .",
    "@xmath49-move _ on a link is surgery along a @xmath49-tree .",
    "@xmath49-equivalence _ is the equivalence relation on links generated by @xmath49-moves .",
    "@xmath49-forest _ is a clasper consisting only of @xmath49-trees .",
    "clearly , the above notions are defined also for tangles , particularly for string links .",
    "what makes the notion of @xmath49-equivalence useful in the study of brunnian links is the fact that a link which is @xmath49-equivalent ( for any @xmath50 ) to a brunnian link is again a brunnian link ( ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 5 ) ) .",
    "note that the @xmath49-equivalence is generated by _",
    "@xmath49-moves , i.e. , surgeries along simple @xmath49-trees @xcite . in the following ,",

    "an @xmath2-component _ string link _ @xmath85 is a tangle in the cylinder @xmath86 $ ] , consisting of arc components @xmath87 such that @xmath88 for each @xmath89 .",
    "let @xmath90 denote the set of @xmath2-component string links up to ambient isotopy fixing endpoints .",
    "there is a natural , well - known monoid structure for @xmath90 with multiplication given by ` stacking ' of string links .",
    "the identity string link is denoted by @xmath91 .",
    "let @xmath83 denote the submonoid of @xmath90 consisting of _ brunnian string links_. here a string link @xmath72 is said to be brunnian if every proper subtangle of @xmath72 is the identity string link .",
    "we have the following characterization of brunnian string links .    [ r12 ] an @xmath2-component link ( resp .",

    "[ r37 ] for two brunnian @xmath2-component string links @xmath126 , the following conditions are equivalent .    1 .",
    "@xmath67 and @xmath127 are @xmath52-equivalent .",
    "2 .   @xmath67 and @xmath127 have the same milnor invariants of length @xmath5 .",
    "3 .   @xmath67 and @xmath127 are link - homotopic .",
    "the equivalence @xmath128 is due to milnor @xcite .",
    "the equivalence @xmath129 follows from the proof of proposition [ r25 ] .",
    "[ r38 ] miyazawa and yasuhara @xcite prove a similar result for brunnian links .",
    "it seems that their proof can be applied to the case of string links .",
    "see also the remark [ r42 ] below .",
    "let @xmath130 denote the set of the ambient isotopy classes of @xmath2-component brunnian links .",
    "let @xmath131 denote the map such that @xmath132 is obtained from @xmath133 by closing each component in the well - known manner .",
    "[ r20 ] the map @xmath134 is onto .",
    "this is an immediate consequence of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 12 ) .",
    "set @xmath136 and let @xmath137 denote the map induced by @xmath134 , which is onto by proposition [ r20 ] .",
    "[ r39 ] @xmath138 is one - to - one .",
    "it suffices to prove that there is a map @xmath139 which is inverse to @xmath140 .",
    "this is proved similarly as in the proof of proposition [ r25 ] .",
    "proposition [ r39 ] provides the set @xmath56 the well - known abelian group structure , with multiplication induced by band sums of brunnian links .    as a corollary",
    ", we obtain another proof of a result of miyazawa and yasuhara @xcite .",
    "[ r40 ] let @xmath0 and @xmath17 be two @xmath2-component brunnian links in @xmath10 .",
    "then the following conditions are equivalent .",
    "1 .   @xmath0 and @xmath17 are @xmath52-equivalent .",
    "2 .   @xmath0 and @xmath17 are @xmath28-equivalent .",
    "3 .   @xmath0 and @xmath17 are link - homotopic .",
    "the result follows immediately from propositions [ r37 ] and [ r39 ] .",
    "[ r42 ] miyazawa and yasuhara @xcite do not explicitly state the equivalence of ( 1 ) and others , but this equivalence follows from their proof .",
    "note that , unlike the @xmath52-equivalence , neither the @xmath28-equivalence nor the link - homotopy are closed for brunnian links .",
    "[ r43 ] it is possible to show directly that @xmath54 is isomorphic to @xmath56 , without using string links and the closure map @xmath138 .",

    "it is useful to introduce a notation for depicting certain linear combinations of surgery along claspers , which we call _ crossed edge notation_.    let @xmath60 be a clasper for a link @xmath0 in a @xmath1-manifold @xmath34 .",
    "let @xmath62 be an edge of @xmath60 . by putting a cross on the edge @xmath62 in a figure , we mean the difference @xmath166 , where @xmath167 is obtained from @xmath60 by inserting two trivial leaves into @xmath62 .",
    "see figure [ f29 ] .",
    "if we put several crosses on the edges of @xmath60 , then we understand it in a multilinear way .",
    "i.e. , a clasper with several crosses is an alternating sum of the result of surgery along claspers obtained from @xmath60 by inserting pairs of trivial , unlinked leaves into the crossed edges .",
    "we will freely use the identities depicted in figure [ f30 ] , which can be easily verified .",
    "the second identity implies that if @xmath168 is a connected graph clasper contained in @xmath60 and there are several crosses on @xmath168 , then one can safely replace these crosses by just one cross on one edge in @xmath168 .",
    "this properties can be generalized to the case where @xmath168 is a connected subsurface of @xmath60 consisting only of nodes , edges , leaves and disk - leaves .",
    "note also that if @xmath150 , is a forest scheme for @xmath0 , then @xmath163 $ ] can be expressed by the clasper @xmath169 with one cross on each component @xmath170 .",
    "throughout this section , let @xmath171 be the @xmath2-component unlink .",

    "the arrow @xmath202 is the homomorphism defined as follows . for @xmath214 , let @xmath122 and @xmath215 be the corresponding simple @xmath92-trees for @xmath29 as in section [ sec : trees - miln - invar ] .",
    "let @xmath216 denote a simple @xmath92-trees obtained from @xmath215 by a small isotopy if necessary so that @xmath216 is disjoint from @xmath122 .",
    "set @xmath217_{j_{2n+1}}\\in \\bj_{2n}(n+1),\\ ] ] which does not depend on how we obtained @xmath216 from @xmath122 , since crossing changes between an edge of @xmath122 and an edge of @xmath216 preserves the right - hand side .",
    "( this can be verified by using a ` @xmath95-version ' of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 4.6 ) . ) for the case of @xmath208 , we modify the above definition with @xmath218 as follows .",
    "let @xmath122 and @xmath219 be as above",
    ". see figure [ f17 ] .",
    "let @xmath127 be the @xmath220-tree obtained from @xmath221 by first removing the disk - leaf @xmath222 intersecting @xmath223 , the edge @xmath62 incident to @xmath222 , and the node @xmath224 incident to @xmath62 , and then gluing the ends of the two edges which were attached to @xmath224 .",
    "moreover , let @xmath225 be a @xmath68-tree which intersects @xmath223 and @xmath226 as depicted .",
    "set @xmath227.\\ ] ]              [ r5 ] let @xmath225 be a clasper for a link @xmath0 such that there is a disk - leaf @xmath222 of @xmath67 which ` monopolizes ' a component @xmath231 of @xmath0 in the sense of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* definition 15 ) , and such that @xmath222 is adjacent to a node .",
    "that is , @xmath67 and @xmath0 looks as depicted in the left hand side of figure [ f19 ]",
    ". then we have the identity as depicted in the figure .",
    "by applying lemma [ r5 ] to the edge of @xmath122 which is incident to @xmath238 but not to @xmath239 or @xmath240 , we obtain the identity depicted in figure [ f18 ] .",
    "let @xmath241 be the box and @xmath62 be the edge as depicted .",
    "let @xmath60 be the clasper in the right hand side . by zip construction (",
    "* section 3.3 ) at @xmath62 , we obtain a crossed clasper depicted in figure [ f20new ] , which consists of two components @xmath122 and @xmath242 .",
    "the component @xmath242 has @xmath243 ( non - disk ) leaves .",
    "we claim that we can unlink the leaves of @xmath242 from @xmath122 without changing the class in @xmath244 . to see this",
    ", it suffices to show that @xmath245 where @xmath246 is obtained from @xmath242 by the unlinking operation .",
    "note that each unlinking is performed by a sequence of crossing changes between an edge of the @xmath92-tree @xmath122 and a link component ( after performing surgery along @xmath242 in the regular neighborhood of @xmath242 ) , and thus can be performed by @xmath52-moves . since all the links appearing in this sequence is brunnian",
    ", we have by proposition [ r27 ] .",
    "this completes the proof of the claim .    by the above claim",
    ", it follows that @xmath247\\equiv[u;t_\\sigma , t']\\pmod{j_{2n+1}},\\ ] ] where @xmath127 is obtained from @xmath242 by removing the leaves , the incident edges , and the boxes , and then smoothing the open edges , see the left hand side of figure [ f21new ] , which is equal to the right hand side by lemma [ r5 ] .",
    "the result is related to the desired clasper defining @xmath248 $ ] by half twists of two edges and homotopy with respect to @xmath29 , and hence equivalent modulo @xmath194 to @xmath248 $ ] .",
    "this completes the proof .",
    "let @xmath249 .",
    "we have @xmath250_{c^a_{n+1 } } = \\sums \\bar\\mu _ \\sigma ( l ) [ u_{t_\\sigma } ] _ { c^a_{n+1}}\\ ] ] in @xmath56 .",
    "( recall that the sum is induced by band - sum in @xmath56 . )",
    "hence we have by the commutativity of @xmath251_{j_{2n+1 } }      & = \\kappa _ { n+1}([l]_{c^a_{n+1}})\\\\      & = \\delta _ { n+1}q_{n+1}\\psi _ { n+1}^{-1 }      ( \\sums \\bar\\mu _ \\sigma ( l ) [ u_{t_\\sigma } ] _ { c^a_{n+1}})\\\\      & = \\delta _ { n+1}q_{n+1}(\\sums \\bar\\mu _ \\sigma ( l ) t_\\sigma ) \\\\      &",

    "hence we have by setting @xmath256 ) & \\text{if $ \\sigma = \\sigma ' $ } , \\\\",

    "gusarov , _ a new form of the conway - jones polynomial of oriented links_. ( russian ) , zap .",

    "j. * 12 * ( 2001 ) , no .",

    "matveev , _ generalized surgeries of three - dimensional manifolds and representations of homology spheres_. ( russian ) , mat .",
    "zametki * 42 * ( 1987 ) , 268278 , 345 ; translation in math .",
    "notes * 42 * ( 1987 ) , no . 1 - 2 , 651656 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> a link @xmath0 in the @xmath1-sphere is called _ brunnian _ if every proper sublink of @xmath0 is trivial . in a previous paper , </S>",
    "<S> the first author proved that the restriction to brunnian links of any goussarov - vassiliev finite type invariant of @xmath2-component links of degree @xmath3 is trivial . </S>",
    "<S> the purpose of this paper is to study the first nontrivial case . </S>",
    "<S> we show that the restriction of an invariant of degree @xmath4 to @xmath2-component brunnian links can be expressed as a quadratic form on the milnor link - homotopy invariants of length @xmath5 . </S>"
  ]
}
